metadata.Title: CVE-2021-40438 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A crafted request uri-path can cause mod_proxy to forward the request to an origin server choosen by the remote user. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.48 and earlier.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-40438` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.18
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.18
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.18
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.18
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.18
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.18
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.18').
